Jacob's radio doesn't really exist and his story is made up, but for a time, he lifts the spirits of fellow Jews.

When handsome pilot Christian (Mathieu Carrire) drops in to visit Anne, Francois becomes jealous despite Anne's insistence that the two are only friends. A paranoid Francois enlists help from a plucky teenage girl to spy on the flyboy in French filmmaker Eric Rohmer's comic misadventure, the first in his "Comedies and Proverbs" series.

Running from her fear of commitment, Louise takes an apartment in Paris, where she intends to revel in a never-ending party. Louise soon realizes, though, that she loves Remi more than she thought.

Among the cast of characters is the newly single Kevin (Smith Forte), who shares space with a bisexual male stripper, a girl who dreams of becoming a rock star, an orphaned teen and an overweight bank teller.

link.synopsis: Kashi (Sunny Deol) is a wrestler in the Indian city of Banaras. When his father (Amrish Puri) is diagnosed with a life-threatening throat disease, Kashi takes him to Bombay in search of a cure. While there, Kashi gets on the wrong side of ruthless landowner Katia (Danny Denzongpa) and his six brothers. Family and territorial conflicts lead to violent confrontations in this action comedy-drama from director Rajkumar Santoshi.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: As a child, Natwar (Amitabh Bachchan) sees his policeman brother kicked off the force after being framed by Vikram (Amjad Khan), a ruthless smuggler. Rakesh Kumar's romantic action-comedy chronicles Natwar's quest for revenge as he leads a double life as the titular underworld kingpin. Since he gives his ill-gotten gains to the poor, however, Natwar's popularity grows, and he soon starts beating Vikram at his own game.

link.synopsis: With his trademark mustache, baggy trousers, floppy footwear and ever-present bowler and cane, Charlie Chaplin became one of the most beloved characters to grace the screen. Silent-comedy devotees will welcome this collection of five of his classic short films. Titles include Cruel, Cruel Love; A Film Johnny; Triple Trouble; The Good-for-Nothing (originally called His New Profession); and Charlie's Recreation (initially entitled Tango Troubles).

In That Uncertain Feeling, which earned an Oscar nod for its score, a lonely wife (Merle Oberon) finds love in the arms of a concert pianist (Burgess Meredith) when her husband ignores her -- and learns he'll do anything to win her back.

This video boasts 11 standout shorts from the studio's vaults, all suitable for children. The set features two of Pencho Kunchev's "Baby Dreams" films and four of Donyo Doney's "Three Fools" comedies. Other titles include De Facto; Beach; The Intelligent Village; Left, Right; and Caw!

link.synopsis: Charismatic con artist Poe Finklestein (Mario Van Peebles) has his eye on the fortune of recently widowed trophy wife Evelyn Weiss (Lesley Ann Warren). But if Poe wants the money, he'll have to wait in line -- and an endless string of relatives seems to have the same idea. When the greed, lust and betrayal meld into murder, everyone becomes a suspect in this mystery-comedy directed by Peebles and co-starring Daniel Baldwin and Lucy Liu.

link.synopsis: Cultures not only clash, they wage war in this touching comedy-drama about family dynamics. Dwayne and Mai, a Vietnamese brother and sister who were adopted in childhood by an African-American couple, face new crises as adults. Dwayne wants to propose to Nina, his beautiful black girlfriend, and Mai has just located her birth mother, Thahn. Writer-director Chi Moui Lo also plays Dwayne.

But there's something more sinister about its occupant, Emil (Bela Lugosi). This 1943 comedy-horror features Gardner in one of her earliest roles on her way to stardom.

Steve Balderson (Stuck!) writes and directs this clever horror-comedy mash-up that has the feel of a John Waters film.

Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th

link.synopsis: A comprehensive tribute to the career of legendary Indian film superstar Amitabh Bachchan, this program showcases the ever-popular performer singing, dancing and acting in a wide variety of movies from fun comedies to serious romances and dramas. Starting out as an action hero in the 1970s, Amitabh has spent many years in the public spotlight as a film producer, TV presenter and even a politician.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A traumatized girl finds her true voice in this moving comedy-drama. Unable to hear or speak, 8-year-old Amy (Alana De Roma) hides from Child Welfare with her loving mom (Rachel Griffiths). But when they move to Melbourne's seedier side, Amy's secret is revealed: She sings like a bird. Encouraged by new friends, Amy sings her way out of her shell and faces the traumatic event that led to her long silence. Ben Mendelsohn also stars.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Adapted from Damon Runyon's short story, Frank Capra's delightful comedy-drama centers on Apple Annie (May Robson), a Manhattan street peddler who lies to her daughter Louise (Jean Parker) through letters, telling her that she's a high-society lady. When Louise plans a visit to show off her royal-bred fiancé, Annie's gangster friends transform Annie into a lady and stage a lavish reception. Frank Capra Jr. provides an introduction and commentary.
link.title: synopsis
You Can't Take It with You

link.synopsis: Count Pahlen (Lewis Stone) is a friend and ally of Czar Paul I (Emil Jannings), but he's starting to question both the czar's ability to rule and the condition of Russia in the 18th century. For the good of his nation, Pahlen joins a plot to assassinate his friend. Directed by Ernst Lubitsch (who was best known for his romantic comedies), this historical drama received five Oscar nods and won for Best Screenplay.

link.synopsis: When a local game warden is murdered, farmer Jesse Hanson (Brian McNamara) is arrested. Jesse's sister-in-law, a successful Chicago lawyer (Lauren Sinclair), comes back to Spoon River to defend him -- but when more bizarre killings take place, she discovers her hometown houses ghastly secrets that are better left unknown. This dark comedy-suspense film is based on the play "Spoon River Anthology" by Edgar Lee Masters.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Isaiah Washington and Nicole Ari Parker (TV's "Soul Food") star in a romantic comedy-drama that provides some sharp commentary on today's TV politics. George and Tomasina become network darlings when the sitcom they've created is a runaway hit. The two become each other's darlings as well, but the pressure to sell out their principles to please the network threatens both their careers and their relationship.

link.synopsis: Elements of MASH, The Hospital and "St. Elsewhere" combine in this romantic comedy/satire set in Hong Kong's Sir Charley Ho Hospital. When an idealistic, young female doctor (Cecilia Cheung Pak-Chi) joins the staff, she's appalled at the incompetence she sees and vows to restore the good name of the hospital and her profession. Jordan Chan Siu-Chun and Ekin Cheng Yee-Kin star in this collaborative effort from directors Johnnie To and Wai Ka-Fai.

Niwas: Prakash (Saif Ali Khan) needs cash to start his dream project (a Web site); Rahul (Fardeen Khan) needs to pay off his landlord; and Harry (Aftab) wants to travel the world. Rahul's everybody-wins plan involves kidnapping Prakash's new wife (Sonali Bendre). Paresh Rawal provides the amusing narration.

link.synopsis: After years of hiding his sexual orientation, David (Steve John Shepherd) is forced to confront his bottled-up attraction to his longtime friend and roommate, Theo (John Simm), when Theo announces his plans to move in with his girlfriend, Hannah (Laura Fraser). But David's attempts to express his feelings for Theo by pushing Hannah out of the picture have unexpected consequences for them both. Aisling Walsh directs this comedy-drama set in London.

link.synopsis: Obsessed with a promotional gas station card game called "Motorama," 10-year-old Gus (Jordan Christopher Michael) escapes from his parents to collect all the pieces he needs to win. When he gathers up his money, steals his father's Mustang and heads out on the open road, Gus meets a mess of quirky people along the way. This unique adventure-comedy from cult director Barry Shils co-stars Drew Barrymore, Meat Loaf and Garrett Morris.

Victor Mature is a self-mocking delight as a narcissistic Hollywood has-been. This 1966 comedy's pedigree boasts a screenplay by Neil Simon, direction by Oscar-winner Vittorio De Sica and a score by pop maestro Burt Bacharach.

link.synopsis: Bob Hope pops up alongside some of Hollywood's biggest stars in this pair of Paramount comedies. In My Favorite Blonde (1942), a good-natured entertainer (Hope) finds himself caught up in espionage when he falls for a secret agent (Madeleine Carroll) with platinum locks. Then, in Star Spangled Rhythm (1942), a sailors' outing to the Paramount lot brings them face to face with Bing Crosby, Dick Powell, Betty Hutton, Mary Martin, Hope and others.

link.synopsis: From 1969 to 1999, one filmmaker directed more films than any other. And it wasn't Coppola, Spielberg or Scorsese. It was Alan Smithee, director of every genre -- comedies, westerns, dramas and more. You wouldn't recognize his face, as Smithee is a pseudonym directors assume when they want to disown a film. Here, you'll get the inside scoop on Hollywood's battles of power and betrayal.

Kyle MacLachlan and John Hurt co-star in this dark romantic comedy-thriller that will keep you guessing to the end.

One by one, the men in the village fall victim to the ghost's insatiable appetite as an eerie silence grips the fear-stricken village and no one dares venture from their homes late at night. Banding together, the villagers conduct an exorcism to rid them of the spirit's wrath.

link.synopsis: In December 1949, Groucho Marx debuted a television comedy/quiz show that had already acquired a huge following on the radio. Although there was doubt as to whether the program would translate successfully to TV viewers, the series ended up having a remarkable 12-year run. This special release includes the entire original pilot, with all the initial blunders, mistakes, off-the-cuff remarks and a visibly nervous George Fenneman as the announcer.

link.synopsis: Budding actresses Kimi and Lana share a roomy Tokyo apartment. They manage to work through most of their minor disagreements, but when the girls find out that they're after the same movie role &NFi;and&NFi_; the same man, the gloves come off. Their fights escalate from heated arguments to all-out power-tool battles! The action takes place entirely within the confines of the apartment and makes 2LDK a thrilling ride for fans of offbeat comedies.

link.synopsis: A group of Indian women in England head to the resort of Blackpool and end up on a life-changing journey. Passionate feminist Simi (Shaheen Khan) organizes the seaside outing for the women's center, whose members range from traditional matrons to flirty teenagers. Despite their differences in age and ideology, the ladies form a lasting bond when one of their own is threatened. Director Gurinder Chadha helms this heartwarming comedy-drama.

link.synopsis: This collection of vintage short comedies features some of the earliest "talkies" written specifically for an African American cast, including "Music Hath Harms," in which a man low on cash tries to fake his way through a cornet-playing contest. Other films in this collection are "The Melancholy Dame," "Oft in the Silly Night" and "Framing of the Shrew," in which a husband gets even with his wife by pretending to have a secret lover.

link.synopsis: Presenting some of Charlie Chaplin's early comedies, this hilarious collection features the talented funnyman failing as a violinist in The Vagabond, attempting to overcome his drunkenness in One A.M. and ineptly fighting a fire in The Fireman. Chaplin also finds himself caught in a bitter rivalry with a fellow store assistant in The Pawnshop, and he gets into boiling water helping his boss pretend to be someone else in The Count.

link.synopsis: When a backward English farmer mates with a barnyard goat, the animal gives birth to an abominable creature they call Billy the Kid in this horror-comedy hybrid that pushes the boundaries of taste and taboo. The farmer's daughter tries to protect the man-beast from her twisted family's violent intentions, but soon the monster develops a nasty killing streak of his own. Michael Balfour and Samantha Perkins star.

link.synopsis: Actresses Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders -- the comedic minds behind their hit show about vice-soaked excess, "Absolutely Fabulous" -- perform together live for the first time in 10 years on the stage of the Bristol Hippodrome in 2000. Paying tribute to the characters they created and poking serious fun at themselves, the duo mixes hilarious sketch-comedy bits with previously recorded video segments for an unforgettable evening.

link.synopsis: Mikami makes her living taking out troublesome ghosts and evil spirits, a job that keeps her and her team of quirky ghostbusters quite busy. When legendary vampire king Nosferatu rises from the grave, they face the biggest challenge of their careers. This time, a ghost has hired Mikami and her gang, fearful that everyone in the city -- living and dead -- will be turned into bloodsuckers in this horror-adventure-comedy anime hit.

link.synopsis: Thrill to the music of three 2004 Bollywood films in this compilation of breathtaking song clips, including "Kyon Hawa," "Hum To Bhai Jaise Hain" and "Aisa Des Hai Mera" from the cross-cultural love story Veer-Zaara. The collection also features "Shikdum," "Dilbara" and the award-winning "Dhoom Macha Le" from action-packed thriller Dhoom,; and "Ladki Kyon," "Gore Gore" and "Main Shayar To Nahin" from romantic comedy-drama Hum Tum.

link.synopsis: Featuring two classic boxing comedies, this video packs a sidesplitting double punch. In The Milky Way, a milquetoast milkman (Harold Lloyd) rises to boxing fame in a series of rigged fights, but can he survive his final bout and win the girl? Adolphe Menjou and Lionel Stander costar. Kid Dynamite sees puerile bully "Muggs" McGinnis (Leo Gorcey) turn against his upstanding friend Danny Lyons (Bobby Jordan); can Danny whip Muggs into manhood?

link.synopsis: Pizza isn't the only thing delivered in this horror-comedy. Zaffo (Michael Haboush) is a pizza-delivery guy who's constantly ridiculed by his friends and co-workers. When a group of teenagers force Zaffo into a homoerotic situation, he finally decides to fight back, enlisting the help of a psychic and an over-the-top gay customer (Bobby Trendy) to cast spells on the boys. Once Zaffo has them under his power, he tortures them … one at a time.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them

link.synopsis: Humphrey Bogart sends up his tough-guy image in a cult classic satire and one of television's most beloved comedies. Five con artists on a Mediterranean cruise try to outwit one another in director John Huston's Beat the Devil, written by Truman Capote. Jennifer Jones, Peter Lorre and Robert Morley co-star. Then, Bogey guest stars on an episode of "The Jack Benny Program," playing a killer named Baby Face grilled by detective Benny.

link.synopsis: Michael Hordern, George Rose and Jean Marsh star in dueling one-act comedies in this uproarious installment of the Broadway Theatre Archive series highlighting the work of playwright John Mortimer. In "The Dock Brief," an ill-prepared attorney is put to the test when his client confesses to killing his wife. In "What Shall We Tell Caroline?" a father with good intentions tries to protect his wife and daughter from the bad things in life.

link.synopsis: London society matron Lady Sneerwell (Patricia Connolly) loves to gossip and spends her free time engaged in manipulation. When she selfishly derails the romance of Charles Surface (Kenneth Welsh), her scheming unexpectedly creates a ripple effect among her well-to-do acquaintances. Blair Brown, Bernard Behrens and Larry Gates co-star in this 1975 Broadway production of one of the theater world's great drawing room comedies.

link.synopsis: Horror film icon Bela Lugosi shares the screen with the lovable East Side Kids in these two creepy comedies. In Ghosts on the Loose, the Kids discover a Nazi hideout, and in Spooks Run Wild, they confront a killer terrorizing the countryside. Wherever their travels take them, Muggs (Leo Gorcey), Glimpy (Huntz Hall), and the rest of the pint-sized gang always seem to find more than they bargained for.

link.synopsis: When he's run down and killed by the angry spirit of a dead taxi driver, Korean cabbie Gil-nam (Seo-jin Lee) discovers that he's become the latest ghost driver in a fleet of phantom taxis cruising the city. Now Gil-nam must find and stop his killer before the specter's rampage claims Gil-nam's still-living girlfriend. Seung-jun Heo directs this horror-comedy hybrid that co-stars Ho Lim, Hae-gyu Jeong and Jae-yeong Jeong.
